thread.title: Review: Martin Amis and ‘The Rub of Time’

author: Daphne Merkin
title: Review: Martin Amis and ‘The Rub of Time’
text: Certitude would seem to be a welcome thing in a critic; it lends his opinions ballast and force. And yet, while reading Martin Amis’s latest collection of essays, “The Rub of Time,” I found myself longing for a little less of it, and for a few grace notes of tentativeness, a soupçon of doubt. Perhaps this is too much to ask of a writer who, from a young age, has been something of a rock star in his home town of London, both as the heir to literary celebrity (his father was Kingsley Amis, his stepmother Elizabeth Jane Howard) and as a prolific man of letters (Mr. Amis published three novels before he was 30 while working...
